Text.Value: And the only terms we offer are between my boot and your treacherous buttocks.
... on this, we agree.

EditorData.NodeContext: Raising his head, no longer despondent.

Text.Value: So it will not be Minsc who does the judging.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Standard animation as he reaches into inventory out of frame - and comes back with Boo in his hand, held over the crowd.
EditorData.NodeContext: Include gesture of getting Boo from magic pocket and holding in front of him, Boo sat in Minsc's Palm.

Text.Value: *Squeak!*
I'm the last to judge, big man. You were just following orders. And hey - that's all you have to do now.
Oh? I don't recall any tales of Minsc helping the likes of Nine-Fingers - a known thief, a murderer. I thought Minsc of Rashemen served the side of good?
Oh? Minsc is wanting is to close your mouth with a kick. And you?
Oh, enough. Zhentarim! TO ARMS!
But the Stone Lord... Minsc... was many times worse. I have no right to judge.
So it's that simple! Drop your weapons, bring out Nine-Fingers, and this can all end peacefully! For you, at least.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Party enters the Guildhall to find Roah standing at the railing, addressing the crwod. Her Zhentarim stand arrayed for battle, with the Guild standing defensively against them. She finishes her line, and turns to greet us.

Text.Value: You're mistaken. Minsc of Rashemen always knows the right thing to do.
Think about this. It defies all logic, I -
I will. But I don't think you'll like my choice.
Oh? I don't recall any tales of Minsc helping the likes of Nine-Fingers - a known thief, a murderer. I thought Minsc of Rashemen served the side of good?
*Squeak!*
Why would you side with this villain? Boo does not... I do not understand.
And the only terms we offer are between my boot and your treacherous buttocks.
Cheer up, Minsc - this is about the greater good. Maybe your hamster will explain it to you one day.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: She cups a hand beside her ear in the direction of Nine-Fingers' office.

Text.Value: The Zhentarim have been trying to crack Baldur's Gate for years, but Nine-Fingers' grip has been too strong. And look what it's come to.
Her Guild is disorganised. Undisciplined. The cult broke them in a matter of days, while my Zhentarim still stand strong.
Think about this. It defies all logic, I -
If you don't know what's right, just let the grown-ups talk. Because I know your friend will make the smart choice.
So it's that simple! Drop your weapons, bring out Nine-Fingers, and this can all end peacefully! For you, at least.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Party enters the Guildhall to find Roah standing at the railing, addressing the crwod. Her Zhentarim stand arrayed for battle, with the Guild standing defensively against them. She finishes her line, and turns to greet us.

Text.Value: MY HAMSTER WILL COUNT TO THREE! LAY DOWN YOUR ARMS, ZHENTARIM, AND BOO WILL SPARE YOUR LIVES!
Fine. Give your Zhentarim the order - we take this place, and split the spoils.
Fine. Let us talk of truth, then. Do your friends know how many you killed in the Absolute's name, Stone Lord? Do you?
And then remain on in the city, to protect its good citizens from any future threats. For a reasonable fee, of course.
The Stone Lord is no more. Boo and Jaheira and my friend would not let me stay cursed.
Justice. Nine-Fingers, punished for what she did to you. And the Zhentarim, rewarded for their stead-fastedness.
We stand with the Guild. So get out of the way.
I'm listening.
My hamster can smell your lies, villain. Foul not his little nose.

EditorData.NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

Text.Value: A Guild under our control can do what Nine-Fingers failed to - drive the Absolute out of the city, once and for all.
Oh, enough. Zhentarim! TO ARMS!
Enough of your filth. Cover your ears Boo. The cracking of the necks of evil will be louder than the mating cries of a snow tiger.
And then remain on in the city, to protect its good citizens from any future threats. For a reasonable fee, of course.
What are you doing? Why turn on the Guild?
Unfortunate. But if you'll only listen a moment, you'll see we want the same thing.
So it will not be Minsc who does the judging.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Standard animation as he reaches into inventory out of frame - and comes back with Boo in his hand, held over the crowd.
EditorData.NodeContext: Include gesture of getting Boo from magic pocket and holding in front of him, Boo sat in Minsc's Palm.

Text.Value: Your leader is not wrong. The Guild is a band of treacherous scoundrels, and Nine-Fingers the worst among them!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Minsc looking up, dejection to hope. He nods and steps forward to stand beside Roah, facing the gathered Zhentarim below.

Text.Value: The Zhentarim have been trying to crack Baldur's Gate for years, but Nine-Fingers' grip has been too strong. And look what it's come to.
I see. That's unfortunate. And what about the adult in the room?
Truly? I am handing you the Guild, and you'd throw it all away on the word of a madman?
*Squeak!*
MY HAMSTER WILL COUNT TO THREE! LAY DOWN YOUR ARMS, ZHENTARIM, AND BOO WILL SPARE YOUR LIVES!
Fine. Let us talk of truth, then. Do your friends know how many you killed in the Absolute's name, Stone Lord? Do you?
What's this, Stone Lord? It's a little late to change the terms of our deal - the pieces are already in place.
Your leader is not wrong. The Guild is a band of treacherous scoundrels, and Nine-Fingers the worst among them!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Minsc looking up, dejection to hope. He nods and steps forward to stand beside Roah, facing the gathered Zhentarim below.

Text.Value: I... do not call me that. Minsc is Minsc!

EditorData.NodeContext: Thrown, but insistent - he does not want to remember the things he did.

Text.Value: What's this, Stone Lord? It's a little late to change the terms of our deal - the pieces are already in place.
*Squeak!*
You're making a big mistake. And for what? There's no sense in this - no profit. Nobody goes against the Zhent and lives.
I... do not call me that. Minsc is Minsc!

EditorData.NodeContext: Thrown, but insistent - he does not want to remember the things he did.

Text.Value: No judgement. It's hard to know the right thing. Better to let others do the thinking, eh?
Hah, a hero. There's a time for heroics, my friend, and a time for common sense. This is the latter.
I'm not. I'm turning on Nine-Fingers - this place has been due a change in management for some time.
But the Stone Lord... Minsc... was many times worse. I have no right to judge.
Enough negotiations, Zhentarim! It's time to take our due!

EditorData.NodeContext: Turning to shout at her people gathered below.

Text.Value: Whatever I told that lot below, this will end in bloodshed. All you have to do is pick the right side.
A Guild under our control can do what Nine-Fingers failed to - drive the Absolute out of the city, once and for all.
My hamster can smell your lies, villain. Foul not his little nose.

EditorData.NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

Text.Value: The Stone Lord is no more. Boo and Jaheira and my friend would not let me stay cursed.

Synopsis:
Origin moment for Minsc with Roah.
After Minsc learns of the Zhentarim plans to overthrow Nine-Fingers, he returns to the Guildhall to confront their leader, Roah. She taunts him with his past evil deeds as the 'Stone Lord' - the player decideds whether to back Minsc and fight Roah, or let Roah's plan come to fruition for the 'greater good'.
ATTN: This double origin moment was degraded to a single origin moment with only Minsc
